result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim M Liebetrau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber for working. 
Sentence may be transferred to any other county defendant wishes.
Concurrent with: with all other probations.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Comply with all conditions of probation on other cases.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kim M Liebetrau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Kim M Liebetrau in court with attorney William A Mayer. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2 thru 4 are dismissed and read-in. 
Neither party request a PSI. 

Atty Isherwood makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Mayer makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
Serve 180 days in jail with Huber for working. 
Sentence may be transferred to any other county defendant wishes.  STAYED 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years:
Concurrent with all other probations.
Comply with all conditions of probation on other cases.
Pay costs.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
No contact with Aspen Dental or its employees. 
Submit to photographs and fingerprinting by the Plover Police Department.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Kim M Liebetrau in court with attorney William A Mayer. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
